Kara grimaced at the reminder. "No, Janet makes it a point to never come near my patrol routes these days." She squinted at the mask again. "I don't recognize the design..."

Atlee set the mixing bowl on the counter, before pulling at the window of Kara's suit. "Maybe whoever it is is still trapped in there! Hello!"

Kara pulled Atlee's head out of her chest. "Hey, personal boundaries! We talked about this." she reached down into her cleavage, feeling around for anything else. "I'm perfectly capable of searching my own body, thank you very much." feeling something in her grip, she pulled her hand back up. But instead of a traumatized heroine, she instead pulled out the torn remnants of the rest of the costume.

After they both stared at it for a moment, Atlee seemed to have an idea. "They must have escaped! But then she must still be here somewhere, right?"

Kara nodded. "I'll find her." Activating her X-ray vision, she started to sweep the apartment.

133132222111.content:
After you saw the titanic figure of Power Girl enter the kitchen, you knew it was only a matter of time until she found you. Her 'X-Ray Vision' would make it impossible to hide, even at your reduced size.

Frantically, you searched your hiding place for anything that might allow you to face your discovery with some small scrap of dignity. Hearing raised voices, and footsteps approaching you, you quickly tore a small price-sticker off the back of a jar, wrapping it around your waist like a kilt.

Not a moment too soon either. right as you finished affixing your impromptu garment, a massive hand reached over your hiding spot, before firmly, but gently grabbing you, and bringing you out into the open, as your world dizzying blurred, your body swung through the air pinched between two fingers, as one might carry a suspicious sock.

When your eyes stopped spinning in their sockets, you could see two faces, both bearing shocked expressions. As you waited for whatever was to come next, you heard the black-haired one-Terra, you reminded yourself- say, "That... doesn't look like a woman to me."
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------

"There! On the counter!" Moving quickly, Kara stepped over to the counter and, keeping one eye on the small outline her enhanced vision showed her, reached a hand over the spice-rack, lightly pinching the figure between her thumb and forefinger, before drawing them out.

Almost immediately, Terra was crowding around her, leaning in so close her eyes were practically crossed, to observe their uninvited guest. Sighing at her friends excitability, Kara nudged her back with her free hand. "They're already scared enough, don't crowd them."

Atlee grimaced sheepishly. "...Sorry." she muttered, before bouncing back into excited mode. "Well? Who is it?"

The two turned their attention to the figure for a moment, before their gazes turned to those of confusion, then shock.

"Um..." Kara managed, before Atlee blurted out, "That doesn't look like a woman to me."

Despite the enormity of what she held in her hand, Kara couldn't help a slight eye roll. "Very observant, Atlee."

As her mind began to fill with explanations for how this could be possible, she observed the little man in her grasp. As she searched his face for any familiar features, she noticed the all-too-familiar look of a man who'd been caught staring at her breasts.

Her mind then began to point out that this...this...miniscule MAN had, at one point been firmly wedged in her cleavage. The fingers that held him quickly became a fist. Walking over to the kitchen table, she unceremoniously dumped the man onto the table, before taking a seat in front of him. "I think you had better start talking, pal."
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------

As you hung suspended in the air between the two arguing Titanesses, you thought now would be as good a time as any to prepare your story. 'After all,' you thought 'This whole thing was all just one big accident.' You remembered how you dealt with unwanted questions from reporters; only give as much information as the question requires, and volunteer nothing.

As you thought back on the events that led you here, your gaze tipped downwards towards the start of your journey, and the twin reasons why you were now stuck in this predicament. While you had been trapped within them for hours, you hadn't really had the chance or inclination to truly appreciate them. As Power Girl's attention was now on Terra as she talked, her hand had lowered slightly, bringing you down to eye-level with her boobs.

And there they hung before you, the siren's call of her cleavage beckoning from within the suit window that had been your doom. The narrow canyon continuously compressed by massive tits, each large enough to comfortably cover a house, from your current perspective.

As you watched, enraptured, you saw the last few miniscule torn shreds of your costume, pasted to her flesh. you idly wondered if she would ever even notice them, much less be able to remove them. Thinking back to the events that caused them to be stuck there, you idly wondered if you'd ever be able to get the rank odor of her titsweat off of you, when you felt
the sensation of being watched.

Raising you gaze, you saw Power Girl staring at you, her expression rapidly becoming angry. Suddenly, the fingers holding you began to squeeze you tighter, slightly crushing your chest, before the rest of her hand closed around you, clenching you in her fist.

A moment later, you were roughly deposited onto the kitchen table, before, Power Girl slammed herself down into the chair in front of you, the forceful movement once again drawing your eyes to her chest as it lightly bounced from the act.

Her frosty tone, however, wiped any remaining lecherous thoughts from your head. "I think you had better start talking, pal."

1331322221111.content:
Being glared at by a woman who can bench-press a skyscraper wasn't exactly how you'd hoped this would go, and was an excellent way to lose your nerve. Wincing under her gaze, you managed, "This is all a big misunderstanding, I promise."

The glare gained a few more degrees of intensity. "That really how you want to start this out?" She spat angrily. "When I said start talking, I meant I wanted an explanation."

You opened your mouth to start again, only to be interrupted by Terra, who had taken a seat to Power Girl's left. "Wait, you can hear him?"

Kara transferred her glare to the girl. "Enhanced hearing. Now don't interrupt, I want to hear how our 'guest' intends to lie his way out of this."

You suppressed the urge to yell that you weren't lying, But it really wouldn't serve any purpose to do so. Steeling yourself, you launched into your tale. "Well, last night, I had decided to make my heroic debut, maybe stop a few crimes, get my hero name out there, that sort of thing. I was getting ready to start my night when I was... interrupted." You paused for a moment, picking your next words carefully. "You sort of...ran into me."

Power Girl snorted derisively. "Yeah, right. and I suppose that your little 'Fantastic Voyage' was somehow my fault, too."

You nodded. "Technically, yes."

Her glare turned slightly more murderous. "I'll give you a chance to re-phrase that."

"I... That is to say my suit has- or rather, it had a built in glider."

She huffed. "I think I would have remembered seeing someone else flying around last night."

"It only works when I'm shrunk down." You really didn't want to come right out and say it, if only because you had no idea how the proud Heroine might react. Better to lead her the truth.

"And so what, you wanted a closer look?" She leaned down towards you, her chest almost laying on the table in front of you. "I'm sure that at your size they must really be something else."

Well, so much for that idea. Valiantly maintaining eye contact, you pushed on. "No. I mean, yes, they are, but no, no I did not - I mean-" Yes. Very valiantly indeed. "Look, I was gliding over the city, I tried to land, and then YOU slammed into ME Tits-first going Mach 5!" And possibly slightly annoyed at this latest turn of events.

For a moment, you thought Power Girl was going to crush you like a bug, but after a few moments, her face changed from angry to shocked. "You...You're telling the truth..." she breathed, her expression evolving into embarrassment. "I- I'm so sorry! I'm just so used to hitting things like birds, and newspapers, and-" She brought her hands up to her face. "Oh, God, it's the Wasp all over again!"

This was not the reaction you'd been expecting. "How did you know that I was-"

"Enhanced hearing, remember?" Terra had lowered her head, practically laying it on the table, no doubt so she could hear you. "She was listening to your heart rate, to find out if you were telling the truth! She does it all the time when we're out on patrol."

"Ah." You glanced back at her, now shaking her head and moaning about careless mistakes, before looking back to Terra. "Is she gonna be alright?"

Terra nodded, narrowly avoiding bashing her chin into the table. "Give her a second to process the whole thing. This isn't the first time this has happened, you know."

You nodded. "She keeps saying something about the Wasp...?"

Terra grimaced. "Yeah." She lowered her voice to a whisper. "A few years ago, all heroes had intersecting patrol routes, to ensure that there was always backup close by. Well, one day, PeeGee was crossing through her shared segment with Wasp, and there was a... collision, kinda like with what happened to you."

"And how did Wasp escape?" You briefly wondered if she'd found a better solution.

Terra grimaced. "She didn't. Poor woman almost died in there. Kara's super strength applies to every part of her. Though I'm sure you're aware of that by now. She was in there until Kara's shower the next morning, and almost got washed down the drain. Costume shredded, wings crumpled, and a LOT of broken bones. Come to think of it, why don't you have any?"

You were not prepared to reveal your other power just yet, so you quickly deflected. "So, her name's Kara?" You asked slyly, causing Terra to quietly 'eep' and cover her mouth. You chuckled, masking your relief before turning your attention back to Kara as she managed to calm herself.

"So,' she managed, before grimacing. "What happened next?"

"After you finally stopped flying around, I managed to peel myself off of your chest. Unfortunately, then..."

And so it went for some time, as you recounted events of the last ten hours or so, explaining everything, including, reluctantly, your squishy properties. By the end of it, Power Girl's face was bright red, and Terra was tearfully apologizing. "-I swear, I never meant to-"

You laughed and waved her off. "Terra, I already told you I forgive you. I was an accident, just like everything else."

Power Girl cleared her throat. "I suppose I should return these to you. I, uh, found them in my...well, you know." reaching out her other hand, she held the remnants of your costume.

"Thank you." You picked up the only intact piece, the mask, and inspected it. Both of the eyepieces were shattered, it stank, and it was absolutely drenched. Wringing it out, both you and Power Girl winced at the river of sweat pooling onto the table.

"Well...I think I'm going to head home, and get some sleep." Stepping to the edge of the table, you willed your self to grow back to your normal size. Stepping off the table, your growth slowed, before stopping back at your usual height. You noted with some embarrassment that you were in front of two very beautiful women, your body reeking of sweat, wearing only a now giant-sized price sticker, and that Power Girl was several inches taller than you. "Thank you for your hospitality, ladies."

As you reached the front door, your hand was just about to grab the doorknob when Power Girl called out, "Wait!"
You turned back to face her as she followed you out of the kitchen.

Which side do you go for?

A: Chose the Heroes

B:Chose the Villains

C: Reader's choice ( I ran out of scenarios for this one. Why don't one of you guys try it.)
155.title: An Opportunity of a Life Time

info.brief_description: You have the super power to shrink  in a world full of super powered women.
info.description:
You are Allen, a rich and bored man who happens to live in a universe where he is the only male with super powers! They aren't exactly the most useful powers but they do provide some excitement and adventure. You can shrink down to a couple of inches tall and your body is almost like rubber. You can be flattened and beaten and stretched without dying or getting ripped apart. It hurts like all hell though and worst of all you can't black out from the pain. You can grow back to normal but only when you are fully 100% healed, which can take a long time and in no pain. Also getting hit with significant force will force you to shrink!

You move to Yorktropolis which is filled with all kinds of super heroines and female villains. These can be women from Marvel/DC/Games/Anime, pretty much anything from the superhero genre. You can even make up your own characters if you'd like.


Rules:

No interaction with men

No scat

No killing Allen
info.pretty_title: Tiny Powers and Super Powered Women
